What are the Scholarships from the Australia Awards?

The highly prestigious and competitive Australia Awards Scholarships (AAS) program gives grants that are paid for by the government to students from all over the world who can show leadership qualities and a desire for change.

The program continues the long-term commitment made by previous Australian governments to provide scholarships to partner nations. It aims to give students the knowledge and abilities they need to help their own country grow.

Over 100,000 international students have received scholarships from the Australian Government to study in Australia since the 1950s.

What is included in the scholarship?

The scholarships cover a range of expenses including:

  • Tuition fees
  • Return air travel
  • Establishment allowances – a contribution towards accommodation expenses, textbooks, study materials
  • Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC)
  • Contribution to living expenses – a fortnightly contribution to basic living expenses paid at a rate determined by the department.

In addition, students will also have access to a range of support services which may include language and academic support if needed.

Who Qualifies for the Scholarship?

The complete list of participating nations can be found on the website of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT).

Kindly note:

By going to our course search page and selecting the “scholarships” tab, you can check for additional scholarship opportunities if your nation is not included on this list.

Individuals with leadership abilities, a strong commitment to development, and the potential to have a positive impact on their communities and countries are eligible to apply to the AAS program.

Award conditions

You will be required to sign a contract stating that you will adhere to the terms of the scholarship if you are selected for an Australia Awards Scholarship. After completing the scholarship, you would also be required to leave Australia for at least two years.

Benefits

Australia Awards Scholarships give students a chance to improve their skills and knowledge. The AAS program also gives students the chance to make lifelong connections with Australia and the wider international community, as well as a global network of fellow alumni.

AAS graduates can use their knowledge and skills to help their home country and community grow after they finish their education.

Deadline

The opening date for the 2024 intake for applications is Wednesday, 1 February 2024 and closing Monday, 1 May 2024 11:59pm AEST. Deadline varies by countries. Click here to check deadline

Scholarships Awards in Australia | Apply now

Applying online

Navigate to the Australia Scholarships Information System (OASIS) online. In order to determine your eligibility, you will be asked a few questions when you register online. After that, you will receive a one-of-a-kind registration number, username, and password.

Your application is not required to be submitted immediately. You have until the closing date listed on the relevant participating country profile to create a draft application form and update it as well as your supporting documentation.

Your application cannot be changed after it has been submitted. Online applicants are strongly encouraged to submit their applications well in advance of the deadline. In the days leading up to the deadline, when OASIS is at its busiest, applicants may experience delays.

Applying by mail

You can still apply by mail if you are unable to do so online. For information on how to obtain a hard copy of the application and any other templates, such as referee reports (if necessary), please check your participating country profile.

By the time your country specifies a deadline, hard copy application forms and supporting documentation must be submitted. Check each nation’s opening and closing dates.
